intro: Porochna paniculata, commonly known as the panicled porochna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Porochna paniculata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
